p: Mice express the cathelicidin mCRAMP (murine cathelin-related antimicrobial peptide), which has high sequence identity with hCAP18 and the porcine cathelicidin PR-39. mCRAMP shows similar expression and function patterns to its human ortholog (Gallo et al. 1997) that is stored in neutrophil granules and is expressed by epithelial cells and leukocytes. mCRAMP knock-out mice have a high susceptibility to infections when compared to wild type mice (Huang et al. 2007; Iimura et al. 2005; Kovach et al. 2012).
